Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Azure Load Balancer, including traffic distribution needs, redundancy, and failover requirements. Identify the applications and services that will use the load balancer.
Design the architecture for the Azure Load Balancer, including frontend IP configurations, backend pools, health probes, and load balancing rules.
Secure necessary approvals and authorizations for deploying the Azure Load Balancer, including budgetary and compliance approvals.
Provision the Azure Load Balancer in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Choose between Basic and Standard SKU based on requirements.
Set up the frontend IP configuration for the load balancer, including public or private IP addresses as per the design.
Configure the backend pool by adding the virtual machines or virtual machine scale sets that will receive traffic from the load balancer.
Create health probes to monitor the availability of backend instances. Define the protocol, port, and interval for the probes.
Define load balancing rules to map frontend traffic to backend pool instances. Specify the protocol, port, and session persistence settings.
Apply security best practices, such as configuring Network Security Groups (NSGs) and enabling DDoS Protection for the load balancer.
Perform end-to-end testing of the load balancer setup, including traffic distribution, failover scenarios, and health probe functionality.
Configure monitoring and alerting for the load balancer using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Set up alerts for health probe failures and traffic anomalies.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of the Azure Load Balancer. Investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Document the load balancer configuration, including architecture, settings, and operational procedures. Share the documentation with relevant teams.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Azure Load Balancer setup.
Conduct periodic audits to ensure the load balancer configuration adheres to security and compliance requirements.
Perform regular audits of NSGs associated with the Load Balancer to ensure compliance with security policies and best practices.
Test failover scenarios to ensure the Load Balancer can handle disruptions and maintain service availability.
Review and update Load Balancer configurations to adapt to changes in application requirements or network architecture.
Regularly back up Load Balancer configuration settings to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Analyze diagnostic logs to identify trends, potential issues, or areas for optimization in Load Balancer operations.
Apply security updates to the Load Balancer and associated resources to address vulnerabilities and enhance protection.
Analyze performance metrics and implement optimizations to improve traffic distribution and reduce latency.
Simulate incident scenarios to ensure the team is prepared to respond to Load Balancer outages or security breaches.
Evaluate the Load Balancer's performance against the SLA to ensure compliance and address any deviations.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Load Balancer performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
Continuously monitor the performance of the load balancer and backend instances to ensure optimal operation.
